remarks: An operator is unitary iff it is linear, onto, and idempotent in the norm.  Similar to theorem in [AkhiezerGlazman] p. 73, and its converse. (Contributed by NM, 24-Feb-2006.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
elunop2 $p |- ( T e. UniOp <-> ( T e. LinOp /\ T : ~H -onto-> ~H /\ A. x e. ~H ( normh ` ( T ` x ) ) = ( normh ` x ) ) ) $.
